alert.note: Alert for Frontier; Hayes; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 9:31PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Frontier, south central Lincoln and Hayes Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 931 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Dickens to near Hayes Center to Palisade. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Curtis, Hayes Center, Maywood, Hamlet, Quick, Marengo, Bluegill Haven Campground, Willow View Campground, Hayes Center State Wildlife Management Area and Red Willow Reservoir State Recreation Area. This includes Highway 83 between mile markers 27 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
